channel.title: Kungsleden 2021 on Richard Strnad

item.title: Kungsleden Day 2 - Cold night, beautiful day
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 7:24 KM: 22.8 Elevation gain in Meters: 439 Start: Shortly after Viterskalsstuganâ€Œ End: Before TÃ¤rnasjÃ¶stugorna Start of day 2 Day 2 started for me at 3am, as i had to pee. Itâ€˜s crazy to get up this early and realize that itâ€˜s bright as during the day. 3am in the morning Overall we slept pretty good, it was on the cold side but tolerable.

item.title: Kungsleden Day 1 - The start (is always hard?)
item.description: Overview Hiking duration: 3:53 KM: 12.08 Elevation gain in Meters: 528 Start: Hemavan End: Shortly after Viterskalsstugan Before the start After we arrived by plane we repacked our stuff directly in front of the mini airport building. Then we went off to get food for the next ~4 days which it will take to reach AmmarnÃ¤s. The local ICA had a nice selection of food. Then we went for a final meal before the start at the â€žAuroras kÃ¶kâ€œ and we both choose the Beyond Burger (Vegetarian).

item.title: Kungsleden Day 0 - Travel, getting to the start
item.description: Overview KM: 0 by foot Start: Rheinfelden End: Hemavan Train, Plane, Hotel and Plane again Getting to the start of the Kungsleden is quite a journey, at least when you live in switzerland or Rheinfelden to be more specific. There are various options, but we decided to go by plane in the end. As there are no direct (or even combined) flights available, we had to split the journey. So the first flight was Zurich -> Stockholm and as there was no flight which allowed us to capture the next flight to Hemavan on the same day, we went for a Hotel in Stockholm.

item.title: Kungsleden T -1 days - Finalizing the equipment
item.description: Equipment for the Kungsleden For this year i wanted to put everything into a lighterpack and i really did it ðŸ¥³ This is mostly for myself and should help me in the future to optimize the weight. Lighterpack Base weight could definitely be better and we are considering a ZPacks triplex for the future. But this is a topic for another day. How does all this stuff look like? I captured two pictures of my equipment, one shows most of the stuff just loose.
